tags: *Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
full_summary:
## Application Software Architect
#### Industry Canada Contract Notice
 Canadian Organizations Invited to Participate in Competitive Bid Process

The Department of Industry Canada invites Canadian firms to bid on a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the application software architect contract.

**Federal Contract Details:**

| **Title** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| Solicitation Number | IC204786 |
| Amendment Number | 0 |
| Publication Date | September 21, 2022 |
| Tender Closing Date | October 5, 2022, at 14:00:00 (bis) |
| Expected Contract Start Date | Not Applicable |
| Expected Contract End Date | Not Applicable |
| Tender Status | Expired |
| Authority for Budget | Not Applicable |

**Classification Information:**

| **Category** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| CPU | Informatics Professional Services |
| UNSPSC ( United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs Standard Products and Services Code) | Not Applicable |
| National Trade Agreements | The contract will be governed by the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) and other applicable Canadian international trade agreements |

**Procurement Documents:**

The procurement documents are available online at the Canada Buy Services Portal: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/09/21/345484847cd18197ff2004f6409afca0/npp_ic204786.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/09/21/345484847cd18197ff2004f6409afca0/npp_ic204786.pdf)

Interested companies can also contact Heidi Gagne at heidi.gagne@ised-isde.gc.ca or 343-542-9135 for additional information.

Please note that this contract has expired and is no longer open for bid. However, the information may be useful in the future.	| 

Note that I reformatted and rephrased the text to make it more professional and concise. I also highlighted the most important details in the contract notice.

This 400-word version includes the following information:

* Contract title and description
* Federal contract details
* Classification information
* Procurement documents
* Contact information
* Important notes

Please let me know if you would like me to make any changes.
